info.title: Fortify on Demand Web API Explorer

get.summary: Get an Application Monitoring Configuration for a given application

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The application id

put.summary: Update an Application Monitoring Configuration for a given application

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The application id

parameters.name: requestModel
parameters.description: The application monitoring config data

get.summary: Get all Application Monitoring Vulnerability for a given application

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The application id

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
A delimited list of field filters.

Field name and value should be separated by a colon (:).

Multiple fields should be separated by a plus (+). Multiple fields are treated as an AND condition. Example, fieldname1:value+fieldname2:value

Multiple values for a field should be separated by a pipe (|). Mulitple values for a field are treated as an OR condition. Example, fieldname1:value1|value2

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The field name to order the results by.

parameters.name: orderByDirection
parameters.description: The direction to order the results by. ASC and DESC are valid values.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the starting record. 0 indicates the first record.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum records to return. The maximum value allowed is 50.

parameters.name: limit

put.summary: Saves the contents to import scan file

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description: Release Id of the scan to import

parameters.name: fragNo
parameters.description: -1 indicates the fragment of bytes has been sent. The value starts with 0 and increments by 1 for each fragment of bytes sent

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the bytes sent. 0 indicates the first bytes

parameters.name: fileLength
parameters.description: The number of bytes of the file being imported

parameters.name: importScanSessionId
parameters.description: The unique importScanSessionId to use for the session provided by GET /api/v3/releases/{releaseId}/import-scan-session-id

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for the scan in MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm format

parameters.description: The framework type id. Only iOS and Android are supported at this time

parameters.description: The time zone

parameters.name: fragNo
parameters.description: -1 indicates the fragment of bytes has been sent. The value starts with 0 and increments by 1 for each fragment of bytes sent

parameters.description: The entitlement id to consume

parameters.name: entitlementFrequencyType
parameters.description: The entitlement frequency type

parameters.name: platformType
parameters.description: The platform type

parameters.name: isRemediationScan
parameters.description: Indicates if the scan is a remediation scan

parameters.name: isBundledAssessment
parameters.description: Indicates if the assessment is a bundled assessment. If not supplied legacy behavior will apply

parameters.name: parentAssessmentTypeId
parameters.description: The parent assessment type id for the bundled assessment. If not supplied legacy behavior will apply

parameters.name: scanMethodType
parameters.description: The method of starting a scan

parameters.name: scanTool
parameters.description: The tool used for scanning

parameters.name: scanToolVersion
parameters.description: The version for the scan tool used for scanning

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
A delimited list of field filters.

Field name and value should be separated by a colon (:).

Multiple fields should be separated by a plus (+). Multiple fields are treated as an AND condition. Example, fieldname1:value+fieldname2:value

Multiple values for a field should be separated by a pipe (|). Mulitple values for a field are treated as an OR condition. Example, fieldname1:value1|value2
